channel.title: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)
channel.description:
Drop windows+apache combos. I don't know if people are generally retarded or just too lazy to do their research but it seems too many focus on actual game code for optimizing server performance (*cough* Kryptix), yet still see their web servers load like shit.
Have you noticed RSCA is the ONLY server that loads quickly on the fly when it's not under attack? KO9/Pets actually did their research and found ways of improving speed/performance and stability, 1/2 of which can be just as easily as setting it up in the right platform with the right tools. Yes, it's important to have a decent host, but do you really need to spend $300+ for some shit win32 server to just increase CPU usage until it lags itself out from high loads? Why do you think most if not ALL high end companies use the linux/unix environment to run their shit?
It's not hard to learn Linux, for a computer-saavy idiot like myself, I was able to learn simple - medium terminal commands within an hour or so (or you can setup the GUI that's usually pre-installed like the Ubuntu distro). Once you've done this, now drop apache (as it's proven to be a resource wasting piece of garbage), and download LiteSpeed(litespeedtech.com) (yes it's faster than you think, tested it myself and can generate pages in less than a few seconds), hell it even has a decent UI if you're completely retarded and need help with it's settings. It even offers load balancing (which generally can increase performance up to x3) with high amount of traffic being generated.
You save money (linux boxes are generally cheaper), improve performance (you can lie and disagree all you want, i've seen it for myself), and actually have something over RSCE. AMG!!!1111

item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

I can attest to VPSLand as being an okay provider. I’ve had them twice before and for Windows, they are pretty good. Linux… not so much.

item.title: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:3, topic:331374”][quote author=KO9 link=topic=427704.msg3141275#msg3141275 date=1267556622]
I wouldn’t dream of running anything server based on a windows box unless I had no other choice. But using an operating system you’re uncomfortable with is going to generate more problems.
[/quote]
You know full well I want to switch to Linux and although I’m a lot better than I was, if something strange happens and I can’t figure it out it will be downtime for hundreds of players and I just don’t wanna risk it in all honesty. Windows ain’t really causing me much stress to be honest, but I do want to switch ASAP.[/quote]What? I was saying if you don’t know what you’re doing with one OS it’s better to use one you do know what you’re doing with, regardless of any performance benefits. (read: I was supporting you)

Read full topic

item.title: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Not bad. With RSCD_v25 on a CENTOS5 VPS I was averaging about a gig of ram usage between a world server and listening server. Xms and xmx had been set properly but the heap space required to run the JVM was far more inflated than it was on Windows. It may have been the virtualization that had been installed by the host though.

Read full topic
item.source: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)

item.title: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

I can recall a time when I was running Apache, MySQL, PHP and RSCD (Demonik source) and I had around 20 players not even breaking 400mb of ram. This was on a CentOS system with Webmin added to manage the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)

item.title: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)
item.dc:creator: @z21 z2
item.description:
@z21 wrote:

I don’t get why this post was made to “attempt” to flame Kryptix. If someone chooses to use windows because thats the OS that they know how to use rather than using an OS that they aren’t comfortable with, its their decision. There are pros and cons to using the windows OS in his situation, and theres also pros and cons to using linux in his situation. It evens out and is probably better for his server to run a windows system until he learns more about the linux system.

Read full topic

item.title: Best advice you'll get about your server (does not apply to easyRSC)
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

I’ve never once defended Windows or Apache, I’d switch to Linux in a heartbeat if I was 100% comfortable with it but I know full well something will happen that I’m not completely sure about and will take an age for me to fix, and I don’t want to put players through that downtime. You act like I’m in denial and argue that it’s the best option or something… Simply not the case.

Keep making excuses bro, somebody will believe you.

Read full topic
